result.execSummary:
The defendant Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have no argumentative or confrontational contact with D. Ludwig, as named in the complaint.

Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:38 am case called. Defendant Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson states resolution on the record. State will move to amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct-Loud & Boisterous. Attorney Szilagyi concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: IMPOSE 20 days WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 2 days served. CONDITIONS: Anger Management and follow through, AODA & follow through,   Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No argumentative or violent contact with D. Ludwig, as named in the complaint. During period of probation-GED or HSED. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Case on track for resolution.  Requests P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states he believes the matter will resolve the matter.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:40 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was found eligible for SPD services.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:10 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant to take all medications as ordered by treating physician.

Case called @ 1:25 p.m. Defendant Marek Scott Duane James Ludwig in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel. Defendant previously declined SPD representation.  NGP entered. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
